DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose study explore effect high versus normal egg-based protein meal acute exercise-induced elevated blood pressure .
DOC.brief_title: The Acute Effect Egg-Based High Protein Meal Hypertensive Response Exercise
DOC.detailed_description: This study design assess BP change post- exercise consumption test breakfast . The design consist three visit . The first visit ass participant aerobic exercise capacity ( VO2 max ) . Visit 2 3 clinical test day subject consume either 13g 30g protein breakfast randomize cross-over manner perform exercise intervention . BP change monitor breakfast consumption , exercise intervention ,
DOC.criteria: Prehypertensive ( systolic , 120139 mm Hg ; diastolic , 8089 mm Hg Age ≥ 21 Body weight < 300 lb ( 136 kg ) BMI 20 34.9 kg/m2 Fasting plasma glucose < 6.1 mmol/L , total cholesterol < 6.7 mmol/L LDL cholesterol < 4.1 mmol/L TG < 4.5 mmol/L No preexist history cardiovascular , renal liver disease Not currently previously ( past 6 mo ) consume weightloss diet special/nonbalanced diet No weight loss/gain ( ±4.5 kg ) within past 6 mo No physical impairment prevent properly exercise execution No caffeine intake day test Hypertensive Body weight ≥ 300 lb BMI < 20 > 35 kg/m2 Pregnant planning pregnancy Unwilling consume study food beverage Fasting plasma glucose ≥6.1 mmol/L Total cholesterol ≥6.7 mmol/L LDL cholesterol ≥4.1 mmol/L TG ≥4.5 mmol/L acute illness smoke diabetic preexist history cardiovascular , renal liver disease currently previously ( past 6 mo ) consume weightloss diet special/nonbalanced diet weight loss/gain ( ±4.5 kg ) within past 6 month physical impairment prevent properly exercise execution caffeine day test
